Author: vices666777
Text: It's more about your thoughts and behaviors around food, if you can honestly live a life you enjoy and aren't being unhealthy my opinion is anyone can maintain any damn weight they want and be fine (within reason, like not 30 lbs over or underweight because then regardless of eating habits your body objectively is not healthy). My personal opinion is that OMAD is trendy marketed disordered eating and you'd probably feel better if you ate throughout the day but who am I to judge. If you can up your calories to a good amount on your own and don't feel massive anxiety about food/your weight then you're fine, but you didn't really put your whole story so idk. The whole thing about having to gain to a certain BMI in order to be free of disordered thinking I have found through personal experience to be absolute bullshit, so I think at this point it's more about learning how to nourish yourself appropriately to maintain and just being more relaxed and happy about eating.
